documentation.text:
@notice has to be called after the launchpad was successful to end the launchpad.
 @dev it creates a liquidity pair, locks liquidty and enables the withdraw of users sale tokens.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct EnumerableSet.AddressSet storage pointer,address) view returns (bool)
literal_string "reffreal not be more than 3 level"

arguments.value: reffreal not be more than 3 level

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "reffreal not be more than 3 level"

documentation.text: @notice withdraws deposited base tokens of the caller if the launchpad failed

@notice withdraws users sale token amount if the launchpad was successful and the
 liquidity pool creation is completed.

@notice withdraws all sale tokens by launchpad owner if the launchpad failed
 the sale tokens are sent to the launchpad owner address
@notice sets if the launchpad is only for whitelisted users by launchpad owner
@notice updates the start and end time of the launchpad by launchpad owner
@notice updates the limit a single user can spend on the launchpad

@notice enegyFi developers can force a fail in case of an unintended behaviour
 @dev security function to ensure the launchpad can be cancelled at any time to unlock funds
@notice returns the current status of the launchpad

@notice updates the start and end time of the launchpad by launchpad owner

 @param _index whitelist index

addLiquidity().details: it creates a liquidity pair, locks liquidty and enables the withdraw of users sale tokens.

params._wbnb: address of the wrapped bnb contract

params._add: indicating if the given user(s) should be added to(=true) or removed from (=false) whitelist
params._users: array of user addresses to be added to or removed from whitelist

forceFailByPancake().details: security function to ensure the launchpad can be cancelled at any time to unlock funds

forceFailIfPairExists().details: this function can be called by anyone and requires the launchpad to be active

params._user: address of the user to be checked

init1(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.details: this function can only be called by the launchpad generator

params._amount: the total amount of sale tokens (min 10 000)
params._endTime: the timestamp of the launchpad end
params._hardcap: the maximum amount of tokens to be reached for success
params._launchpadOwner: the owner address of the launchpad
params._liquidityPercent: the percent of locked liquidity in parts per 1000 (min 250)
params._lockPeriod: the duration of the locking period in seconds
params._maxSpendPerBuyer: the total amount of base token a specific buyer can spend
params._softcap: the minumum amount of tokens to be reached until end time for success
params._tokenPrice: the amount of sale tokens for one base token

init2(address,address,uint256,uint256,ad.details: this function can only be called by the launchpad generator

params._baseFeeAddress: the receiver of the base token fee amount
params._baseToken: the token to purchase the sale token
params._launchpadToken: the token to be sold in the launchpad (sale token)
params._pancakeTokenFee: the fee on the sale token by adding liquidity in parts per 1000
params._referralAddress: the receiver of the sale and base token referral fee amounts
params._referralFee: the fee calculated on base fee an token fee in parts per 1000
params._tokenFeeAddress: the receiver of the sale token fee amount

userDeposit(uint256,address[],bytes[]).details: this function uses msg.value and ignores _amount param for BNB as base token. The correct amount is required for ERC20 base tokens

params._amount: the amount of base token to deposit

addLiquidity().notice: has to be called after the launchpad was successful to end the launchpad.

editWhitelist(address[],bool).notice: update the whitelisted users by owner. Users can be added to or removed from whitelist

forceFailByPancake().notice: enegyFi developers can force a fail in case of an unintended behaviour

forceFailIfPairExists().notice: set the status of the launchpad to failed, if a the liquidity pair exists on pancakeswap before the launchpad is successfully finished

getLaunchpadStatus().notice: returns the current status of the launchpad

getUserWhitelistStatus(address).notice: returns if a user if whitelisted

getWhitelistedUserAtIndex(uint256).notice: returns the users address at the given whitelist index

getWhitelistedUsersLength().notice: returns the total number of whitelisted users

init1(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.notice: first initilize function sets launchpad information by the launchpad generator

init2(address,address,uint256,uint256,ad.notice: second initilize function sets launchpad information by the launchpad generator

ownerWithdrawTokens().notice: withdraws all sale tokens by launchpad owner if the launchpad failed the sale tokens are sent to the launchpad owner address

setWhitelistFlag(bool).notice: sets if the launchpad is only for whitelisted users by launchpad owner

updateDuration(uint256,uint256).notice: updates the start and end time of the launchpad by launchpad owner

updateMaxSpendLimit(uint256).notice: updates the limit a single user can spend on the launchpad

userDeposit(uint256,address[],bytes[]).notice: deposits the given amount of base tokens and calculates the equivalent amount of sale tokens owed by the caller.

userWithdrawBaseTokens().notice: withdraws deposited base tokens of the caller if the launchpad failed

userWithdrawTokens().notice: withdraws users sale token amount if the launchpad was successful and the liquidity pool creation is completed.
